column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column6: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 2. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column6: Immediately come to a complete stop
column8: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column10: Slow down and be prepared to stop

column2: 3. ABS is the acronym for:
4. Your ability to drive safely can be impaired by:
column6: drugs, even if they are over-the-counter.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
6. Warning signs normally are:
7. If your vehicle starts to hydroplane you should:
column4: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.
column6: apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.
column8: slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

column2: 8. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 9. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 10. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
11. This road sign means:
12. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
13. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column6: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column8: stop, look left, then right, then left again.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead of you.

column2: 14. An aggressive driver:
column6: shows little or no respect for traffic laws.
column8: weaves in and out of traffic.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column10: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow

column2: 16. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
17. When you are driving, turning your head and looking before changing lanes is:
column10: unnecessary, you should use your rearview mirror instead.

column2: 18. If you suddenly have no control of the steering wheel, you should:
column4: ease your foot off the gas pedal. Turn on your emergency flashers and allow your vehicle to come to a slow stop.
column6: pump your brake pedal to build pressure.
column8: turn on your emergency flashers and pull off the road.
column10: react as you would with a blowout.

column2: 19. Do not pass:
column4: when school bus lights are flashing.

column2: 20. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
21. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
22. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
23. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you should:
column4: disregard the signal if there are other lanes available for the emergency vehicle.
column6: immediately come to a complete stop.
column8: slow down, provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.
column10: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.

column2: 24. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column8: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 25. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column6: The last driver to reach the intersection.
column8: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.

column2: 26. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column6: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.
column10: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.

column2: 27. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column10: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.

column2: 28. The octagonal shape is used:
column8: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column10: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
30. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column10: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 31. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column4: at the center of the road
column6: to the left of the road
column8: to the right of the road

column2: 32. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: on the left shoulder of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 33. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column8: there is a right turn ahead.
column10: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 34. You are approaching an intersection when the signal turns yellow. You should:
column4: speed up to get through the intersection before the red light comes on.
column6: stop then enter the intersection when safe to do so.
column8: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.

column2: 35. Drivers must not drive at:
column4: a speed that is greater than reasonable.
column6: a speed that is not prudent for the circumstances.
column8: a speed that is greater than the posted speed limit.

column2: 36. This sign means:
37. Most signs used in street work areas are:
38. Before turning, you should:
column6: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.

column2: 39. This road sign means:
40. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column4: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.
